attributes.action: Reject the Children’s Wellbeing and Schools Bill's proposals on home education
attributes.additional_details: Mandatory registration would undermine trust, interfere with home educators, and ignore why parents choose home education: the right to educate freely without interference. This is a basic human right and parental responsibility, and it infringes upon British values of educational freedom and diversity. We understand that if a child requires social services, the government could intervene, but for mainstream families, we want no interference.
attributes.background: Do not pass any part of the Bill that introduces mandatory registration, monitoring, or oversight for home-educating families. Home education should remain flexible and free from excessive government control or interference.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petitions, which call for similar action: 

Remove CWS Bill clauses and provide tangible support to home educating parents
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/716515

Don't introduce unique child identifier and increased home education regulation
